translation: The [six inexhaustible metaphors] have sixteen characteristics that the sūtras label as four metaphors that also give rise to their causes. 1. it means that because they believe form is self, they fix themselves in their bodies. 2. because they see the self-nature as omnipresent, they believe I have form. 3. because they see previous conditions following self, they believe form belongs to self. 4. because they see the continuity of all the formative forces, they believe I'm in form, feeling, perception, volition, and the three are likewise considered to be the sixteen views Baoge jing lun, which says that self refers to the nature of mastery, and what belongs to self refers to the nature of the five aggregates.
